Javins v. First Nat'l Realty Corp., 428.raw_text: Javins v. First Nat'l Realty Corp., 428 F.2d 1071 (D.C. Cir. 1970)
Javins v. First Nat'l Realty Corp., 428.proposition: A landlord breaches that covenant when the landlord's actions or omissions render the premises unfit for ordinary residential use or otherwise materially deprive the tenant of the beneficial enjoyment of the premises.

Hilder v. St. Peter, 478 A.2d 202 (Vt. 1.proposition: - Hilder v. St. Peter, 478 A.2d 202 (Vt. 1984) (recognizing warranty of habitability principles).
Hilder v. St. Peter, 478 A.2d 202 (Vt. 1.support_reasoning: The opinion squarely and explicitly adopts an implied warranty of habitability in Vermont residential leases and elaborates its scope, breach standards, and remedies. The court states that it is now expressly holding that such a warranty exists in all residential tenancies and applies that doctrine to the facts, so the case clearly recognizes warranty of habitability principles.
Hilder v. St. Peter, 478 A.2d 202 (Vt. 1.relevant_excerpt: “Therefore, we now hold expressly that in the rental of any residential dwelling unit an implied warranty exists in the lease, whether oral or written, that the landlord will deliver over and maintain, throughout the period of the tenancy, premises that are safe, clean and fit for human habitation. This warranty of habitability is implied in tenancies for a specific period or at will.”

Massachusetts General Laws Chapter 111 (.proposition: - Massachusetts General Laws Chapter 111 (Public Health) and statutory authority for the State Sanitary Code.

M.G.L. c. 111, \u00a7 127A.proposition: - M.G.L. c. 111, § 127A (authority for minimum standards of fitness for human habitation and enforcement).

Massachusetts State Sanitary Code, 105 C.raw_text: Massachusetts State Sanitary Code, 105 CMR 410.000 et seq.
Massachusetts State Sanitary Code, 105 C.proposition: - Massachusetts State Sanitary Code, 105 CMR 410.000 et seq. (Minimum Standards of Fitness for Human Habitation), including applicable provisions addressing heating and hot water (see generally 105 CMR 410.100–410.200).

105 CMR 410.100\u2013410.200.proposition: - Massachusetts State Sanitary Code, 105 CMR 410.000 et seq. (Minimum Standards of Fitness for Human Habitation), including applicable provisions addressing heating and hot water (see generally 105 CMR 410.100–410.200).

M.G.L. c. 186.proposition: - Massachusetts landlord-tenant statutory provisions governing tenancies, habitability, and related matters, including M.G.L. c. 186 (general provisions relating to landlord-tenant law).
